comments.body: Hear here

Yes please! A very useful use case is making some sort of magical item, where if you right click, it would spawn an entity, and if you attack (left click) an entity, it would kill the entity instantly.

With current state of the interaction entity, you can only right click, but not attack, since attacking would attack the interaction block itself.

I'm sure there is a workaround to this, but it would be too redundant, hard to maintain, and too complex for beginners and map makers.

Mojang, please fix!

There is a ton of potential for these, but the big ones that immediately stick out:
1. Ability to set depth. Only having height and width really limits this.
2. Ability to set whether the hitbox consumes the click/clickthrough
Yes please! This change is absolutely needed
Unless this is already in the game and we are missing it, this is the one thing that would truly allow these new entities to become the best right click detectors in the game.

Just ran into the same problem. Blocking interactions through the entity makes it unusable for a lot of common usecases. A simple `block_interactions` boolean tag (or something alike) would improve it massively. Even better if this was handled separately for left and right clicks, so maybe `block_attacks` and `block_interactions`.

The continued doubling-down on the player report system would be funny, if it weren't so sad.

The chief piece of feedback people continue to have is to remove the system entirely, and it feels like it's just fallen on more and more deaf ears. It's subjective and ambiguous, it's distrustful of players and existing server moderators, it's going to be abused no matter what, and it presents a breach of privacy for unreported players to boot.

In no uncertain terms, it is fundamentally a bad idea. Please, just get rid of it.

Mojang, Microsoft, whoever is in charge of this, if you're listening:

 

PLEASE either remove this or make it Opt-In only for third party servers, especially Private servers. And ESPECIALLY remove the "No Multiplayer Allowed" function of the ban, as just because you get banned on one giant server that has Dolores Umbridge levels of moderation shouldn't mean you aren't allowed to play on a tiny server your brother on the other side of the country runs.

 

There's a REASON people made mods to bypass the encryption.

Mojang did not address the issue with editing and removing content from the reports file, yet continued to defend that it was "unable to be falsified".
You need to make sure that ALL messages that are part of the report use a cryptographic signature linking back to the previous message so that any context that is REMOVED does not alter the context of the report! Multiple YouTubers have shown this is possible and not avoidable with the current system.

But then, there will now almost be a new mod that tricks the system into thinking that the chat is real and approved. There should just be a system that detects if chat is modded, and if it does, shows a pop up stating how it could be unsafe because chat is modded :

 

Chat is modded

This server uses mods to tinker around with chat and might disable certain chat filters or chat reporting. Are you sure you want to continue?
Please rollback the "enforce-secure-profile" change so it defaults to false as it was prior to this pre-release.
These features are awful, and nobody wants them.
Well, the feedback going to the shredder is indeed confirmed after all.

Please give the playerbase an option to disable the visual feedback for modified chat messages. I can imagine it getting quite distuptive for servers using their own chat moderation system, that actively modifies chat messages to prevent harrassment in the first place.

I think besides it you should add a new splash — "Minecraft 1.19.84", to honor the memory of one of the most brilliant writers of all time.

Or another one — "We listen you", to show how important the community word is to you, Mojang :)

But the best, in my opinion, is "Minecraft 1.19.84: we listen to you".

Remove the chat reporting “feature” entirely. This directly goes against the nature of private servers, and is EXTREMELY easy to weaponize against active players. No Minecraft players want this, as much as Mojang has been lying otherwise.

If implemented, this will NOT help Minecraft, rather it will only push players to use illegitimate versions of the game. Not to mention, it will also clutter existing chat messages. AT THE ABSOLUTE BARE MINIMUM, THE CHAT FEATURE NEEDS TO BE OPT-IN NOT OPT-OUT.

A WORSE DECISION THAN ADDING ADS TO NETFLIX.

I wouldn't be surprised if servers refused to update to 1.19.1 this update is one of the worst you've ever made not only is it controversial, downright disgustingly distrustful of the community you also double down on it and take the blame for it exposing yourselves to countless death threats from people who were criticising MICROSOFT and not you ... frankly you should scrap the entire 1.19.1 update and pretend that it never existed
Get rid of chat reporting, or at least make it toggleable for server owners. I don't want to be afraid to chat on my own server :/
Microsoft, please stop.
It feels disingenuous to keep making these feedback posts if you're clearly not going to listen to them.
Private servers should still be able to opt-out. People who know each other IRL should be able to chat as they do IRL.
get rid of it. good day.
After owning the game for 11 years, this is the worst patch I have ever seen implemented. Server owners have done absolutely fine with moderating chat without this spyware from Microsoft.
Microsoft, you have disgraced yourselves.
Disgraceful. You're asking the community for feedback and completely ignoring it and then have the audacity to continue asking for more feedback.

I honestly like the idea of Mojang handling chat reports. As you mentioned, it significantly helps server owners who don't have the capabilities to handle a full moderation team.

However, I'm VERY concerned about the lack of communication on opting-out, and just generally what that process looks like. I'm okay with it being on-by-default, server operators (such as myself) know how to adjust server.properties. However, there's been no clear communication from you about if we'll have the option to turn it off both when 1.19.1 releases and in the long-term future.

Additionally, I think the warning for unsigned messages should be disable-able on the client side. Make it an option that those who's Microsoft accounts are under parental controls can't change (or something similar to that) and I think you'll find a great middle ground between those who don't want to deal with global chat moderation and those who want to be protected by it.
Drop chat reporting

Just please don't add chat reporting that superseeds servers own server moderation. Please don't add this feature AT ALL. If this goes through I'm never going to be able to enjoy this game without fear again.

This is a incredibly needless change, especially forcing it upon player owned servers. Most servers are already chat moderated by the owners themselves, if your concerned about children seeing things they shouldn't, making it so people can put an age restriction on their server's would be a much better way of going about it.
Chat reporting on privately owned servers is a mistake.

Adding to the noise here, another post about how this is a bad idea. Notice how unanimous this negative feedback is, should you proceed down this route you send a clear message you neither care about feedback nor your customers in general.

It take maturity to acknowledge when an idea was a mistake. Now is the time to show it.

Last update you received overwhelming amounts of critism due to your unnecessary implementation of chat reports, and to respond to that critisim you doubled down on the reporting even more. Start listening to the community. Stop this update.

"Chat Trust Status"

...Because yes, individual players needing to be able to see whether or not chat messages are signed directly in the chat was one of the community's primary concerns. This was clearly the most important factor that needed to be addressed, and not...y'know, the ability for the client to basically completely falsify the context around any reported message. mods could made the replace any message with ban worthy ones

Please, cancel reporting system.

P.S.: Why my previous comment is being moderating for 5 days already?

Can you fix cave biomes based on this planetminecraft datapack called better cave gen

as the 1.18 cave biome layout is boring and needs work

this is a side note 

get ride of chat reporting

I know that Microsoft is just trying to make this game more kid-friendly, but c'mon, literally everyone hates the idea of a chat reporting system. It sounds good in theory but Communism sounds good in theory too but look at what happened with that "great" idea. That's a pretty realistic example to compare it too. I don't see anything good to come of this new system and it only points in the wrong direction. Also 1.19 was awesome maybe a few promises weren't upheld but the update was still very good.
Stop making these feedback posts. It's pretty clear that you don't actually care about users or their feedback.
Third party servers do not require centralized moderation. I do not trust multi billion dollar Microsoft to be the arbiter of morality. Allow us to use our private servers as we please.
Minecraft does not need a universal chat moderation system pls remove it in the 1.19.1 update
Why even ask for feedback if all you're going to do is completely ignore it? Right, you have to save face and pretend that you still care.

There is no need to add chat reporting, because servers already have their own moderation. There are concerns with some servers having bad moderators, but that is most likely a server unlike Hypixel. A system could instead be implemented in which parents could be notified if their child joined a less known server, and then the parents can take the decision into their own hands on whether their child should play on that server or not. If people are worried about someone abusing someone else in a server, I think that most people would be against it and would provide help and support to the abused person while calling out the abuser and talking to server admins to remove the abuser. If the admins don't, well people won't play on that server anymore, because of the people who run it. Personally, I think Microsoft is just trying to get control over Minecraft players, which I am certain will not do them well and can only begin the downfall of Minecraft. Thank you.
Please don't implement this feature.
In honour of Technoblade you should make it so when you put a nametag named technoblade on a pig it should wear a crown! It’s a very simple feature and it would be a great memory of the pvp king
Listening to the community? Microsoft for the love of Minecraft drop chat reporting. The majority of players do not want this, do not like this, and want it gone. Please listen.
Privately hosted servers should be able to opt out of the moderation tool.

Firstly, objectively there is absolutely no way an independent party can review chat messages with proper context and make decisions accordingly. No matter how many chat messages you decide to grab around the reported message, there is no way you can judge it better than a designated moderator of the server itself. There are bound to be more wrongs than a server's own management system. And this is IF this report system isn't released in a state where it can be exploited to hell and back.

Secondly, from a moral standpoint, it seems as if Microsoft is trying to say: "Trust us, we know what's best for you, even better than you do". It simply draws away from the autonomy of privately hosted servers. The fact that you can get banned across every single server is also ludicrous.
The feedback is quite clear and I don't need to stress how negative it is. 

I feel bad for the (hopefully existing) devs at mojang who are having to follow these orders and implement a feature the community is overwhelmingly against.

Private servers have their own moderation staff that do a far better job than a mass reporting system. The chances for false bans is way too high when your own guidelines are vague and lacking context. Minecraft has been self moderated for years. There's no need for it.

Still going for reporting, just waiting for the inevitable lawsuit for Microsoft/Mojang trying to control what happens on servers they don't pay for or manage

If they want to control what happens on the server they should pay for the server, either remove the feature or pay me for the server hosting
What an awful, awful change. How about you let server owners moderate their own servers? This Orwellian garbage you're trying to force feed us is going to destroy this game.
Remove the report system most people will not switch to 1.19.1 if you add this
This update is unnecessary and harmful to Minecraft.

It's useless and obsoleted like any other game
We community better moderation system
Thank you for concerned us but we are good

This is very bad for minecraft reputation in player base and a discouragement for ppl even try to get realm or even be active and stick to community, more importantly it's a threat to people talk freely and feel safe in their gaming experience, I play multiplayer server with my friend, and my self they r fun because there's no moderation and I like to keep it that way, if I ever play a version with that installed I will definitely get the plugin or mod prevent chat reporting, because ITS NOT TWITTER.
don't implement chat reporting pls
No one wants chat reporting, axe it already!
Keep your disgusting mitts out of our game microsoft

The vast majority of the community agrees that a centralized authority determinining what you are allowed to say or not is both ineffective and an over reach of power. It has been shown time and time again that such systems are both easily abused and avoided.

The minecraft community has been policing itself since the inception of multiplayer, and is better equipped both in manpower and context for each situation.

I don't want to be falsely banned from multiplayer. Please, Mojang, listen to the MC community, and don't add the so called "safety features" into the game. Or if you don't like that, at least allow server owners to choose to toggle it or not. I'm starting to get concerned about the future of Minecraft.
Private servers don't want your third party moderation, please don't add this!
Please add option to disable chat reporting to server config. I don't want to fear of getting banned from online play. Let server owners handle the things as they used to be for a long time.

"As always, we want to hear your feedback on this and other features"

No you don't. Please stop with these posts. They are completely useless at this point.
Why are you still releasing snapshots with chat reporting at all if you know that the vast majority of your players don't want this feature?
Yoo microsoft corporate entity and swedish meatballs.. GET RID of the chat reporting nonsense.

This is only going to be abused by the very people you're trying to "help" stop, on top of being a terrible privacy concern. Moderating this is going to be an utter nightmare - as long as that button is there and people are talking, you can send in a report at absolutely no cost to yourself and a potential permaban for the person you're reporting. This is going to result in a massive slew of false reports, and if I were the poor sap tasked to moderate it all, I'd just quit.

The only way this is going to go well is if you remove this chat reporting feature entirely. Full stop. Servers are already doing what Microsoft is attempting to do, and they've been doing it better for years. This privacy-breaching update will only hurt Minecraft as a whole, and you seem to want it to burn. Is this what you want? Do you want one of the biggest franchises ever to burn to the ground because you falsely assume these independent server moderators are incompetent?

I'm frankly disgusted with the direction this game is going. I really, really hope you change your mind before it's too late, but I know my hope is falling on deaf ears. The best outcome I can see at this point is that you remove this chat reporting feature after the inevitable onslaught of reports. Even that sounds like a pipe dream.

Microsoft, Mojang, don't do this to Minecraft.

Please add better parental controls and age ratings for servers. This is a reactive feature, but other features could better help safety. Parents should get to choose which servers their kids can play on.
can you make it togglable of scrap it entirely

Do not implement chat reporting. Get rid of it. Remove it. Virtually no one wants this.
Also, Mojang, I thought you're better than this.
Remove chat reporting please... why remove a moderation system that has worked PERFECTLY for many years with a worse flawed one..? Please... just scrap it...
Stop asking us for our feedback if you will not listen to the community. It’s insulting that you pretend to care.

What ever happened to Java Edition "staying seperate" from Bedrock? Why are you enforcing a report system despite the fact Java servers have been able to handle moderation perfectly fine up to this point? Why do we need to potentially need to rely on MODS and PLUGINS to disable this feature because of how dangerous and unnecessary it is for Minecraft?

There have been cases in the past where report systems like this have been abused. May I remind you of MCAdmin? It was an attempt to add a global moderation system back in  where servers which had said plugin would perma-ban you if you were banned on 3 or more other servers running the plugin. It's downfall was caused by Team Avolition, which abused this feature by making their own servers running the plugin and banning random users, including the staff team behind the MCAdmin plugin. The VERY SAME THING could happen with users mass reporting players.

Take your move, Microsoft.
Get rid of chat reporting

the "chat reporting" feature has to be the worst feature to ever be added to a game as free and publicly sourced as Minecraft, It's insane how despite the extreme negative feedback from people who have been supporting this company for years this company still thinks its a good idea to add this to its main product, its absolutely disgusting and the future of Minecraft is looking terrible, remove the chat reporting feature for every single future Minecraft Version.

My feedback for this is the same as it has been: player chat reporting is a fundamentally flawed system. It is subjective, blind to what happens in-world, far too easily abusable, a potential breach of privacy, and somehow asks us to trust the opaque moderating decisions of a third-party team over the informed, first-hand decisions of individual server mods. Your team is in an objectively worse place to make decisions. This whole thing is at best a farce, and at worse a money sink ripe for you to silently convert over to automation without telling us.

Remove player chat reporting. Full-stop.
Please make the reporting system at least toggleable? I don't wanna need to install third party mods just to disable it.
No one wants chat moderation. Stop ignoring your player base.

As a server owner, this update is outrageous. Before, it was possible to moderate your own server however strictly you wanted to. Now? Now everyone, younger than or older than 18 has to follow Microsoft / Mojang’s own idea of moderation.

All age groups have the same moderation. Private servers are not under the owner’s control. Realms are not under the owner’s control. False bans will be almost impossible to avoid and will occur to a good portion of the player base.

If this gets implemented it will mark the downfall of one of the greatest communities on the Internet. Where choices were up to the player base, not a distant corporation who wants to extend the profitable margin to a younger player base.

Before this I felt that Mojang was involved with and noticed the community. Now? People’s complaints are getting ignored on one of the most controversial updates yet, much like this feedback will likely be ignored as well.

This implementation of chat reporting looks like a horrible moderation tool. The only context for the report is the chat log. It leaves players opened to being griefed or even antagonized outside of the game and then reported based on their reaction to related person in game, then potentially banned. Chat reporting is unable to provide accurately context to what is actually occuring in game/server community. A chat moderator will never have the tools needed to resolve any of these issues, especially when you consider the number of people that play minecraft. Someone that moderates their own server is in a significantly better position to deal with these issues because they would be closely involved with their local server community. They would also be able to commit more time per issue within their local server than outsourced moderators that are responsible for moderating all reports received from anyone online seding one.

Player report feature is harmful both to players and server admins. Besides, servers offer much better reporting systems than what you have in place here.

You are literally incentivising people to move towards playing on pirate servers with reporting forcibly turned off via chat plugins.

Your "highly trained" moderators do more harm than good, as it is evident by many cases of them failing to recognize the context of messages players were falsely banned for.

As a server admin I received a major backlash from the community after moving to 1.19 because of this feature. Please, remove it. We don't need your corporate control and lousy moderation on JE, we had and will have much better time without it.
Nobody wants Microsoft running Minecraft. You are ruining the game we once loved.

I’d love to understand why Mojang keeps making new post instead of just using a preexisting post when they all are about the exact same topic but atlas I will probably never get an actual answer.

To get back onto the main topic I am not a fan of this feature as I do not like the idea of Mojang recording my messages should anyone in a server be reported regardless of if you are actually breaking rules, and having such information be kept for unknown amount of time and use for unspecified reasons. I also don’t like the idea of getting banned from multiplayer entirely even if temporary because from what I’ve seen and experienced with Mojang support it takes forever to get responses and I doubt an underpaid and understaffed moderation team will do any better for a game as large as Minecraft.

I genuinely don’t even understand why Mojang decided they needed a global moderation systems when they already mention multiplayer is unregulated. Should I be in Mojang position I would focus on giving the community the tools they need to moderate servers on their own which not only takes less resources than global moderation (as server administrators can do the work themselves) but also leads to faster results where people who administer Servers will have added context of what happens on and off the server allowing them to make more information decisions than any moderator Mojang can train.

Instead of Microsoft trying to take control of privately owned servers. They could convert the report system as optional tool to help people moderate their own servers by alerting the admins server with in game report system and the server owners could decide on the action they wish to take. Maybe have it only alert Mojang if the infraction is something that is illegal in the hosted country(eg.doxxing).

 
Or just get rid of the report system entirely. Your not fooling anyone ,Microsoft is trying to control a narrative of a discourse space  like every social media platform does. 

So if a Mojang employee actual reads this , please do speak with your higher ups and petition to get the chat report system removed or replaced. Please do not let the trust of you have worked so hard to build up over 11 years go to waste by one foolish decision.

 

Sincerely, a player who has loved and played this game for over 11 years.

Please remove the reporting System or at least make it optional.
We already have the option to mute people and I don't want your moderators to decide if I want to read the swearing of other, I dont want your moderators to decide what is to much, I don't want your moderators to decide who is able to play on my server.
You have already proven how flawed the system is on the Bedrock Edition. DON'T INFECT JAVA WITH IT. I dont want that PaRiTy.

I know you only care about sales, but do you want to advertise a "friendly comunity" or a "muted comunity with occasional random bans".

It's simply a bad idea!
And I'm not the only one who thinks so, so for once keep your word and listen to the comunity!

Please!

For every comment praising your mediocre moderation bot (let’s be honest, there’s no way for your team to manually moderate the chat from millions of players) there are well over a hundred more criticizing it.

If this goes through I’m never touching multiplayer again. I didn’t pay for spyware.

I have been here since 2011, but this might be where I get off.

I know some times unpopular features can make the game better, such as changing old chunks to add terrain under them, like in 1.18, but this feature is not going to be beneficial to the game. The permanent global bans have been added in Bedrock Edition, and the players hate it. The majority of the community has proven to be against this change, this includes major youtubers, like: TheMisterEpic, FitMC and Antvenom. It seens like every update with the number 9 gets controversial, starting with Beta 1.9. Many people will be unfairly banned, and it would be better having 10 false negatives than 1 false positive.

Make it so that if you are 13 years or up you can turn off profanity filters. If people want to have PG-13 servers in Minecraft. they should be able to. Or flat out remove this feature. Stop making java edition like bedrock. No true Minecraft fan would rather play bedrock then java. Bedrock=trash Java=good.

Moderation "tool"? Moderation "abomination" would be more accurate. There are far too many flaws with this: from the fact that it's fixing a problem that didn't need fixing, to the large margin for error, to the dire consequences of said errors, and to the sheer number of global moderators that would be required for such a system. It's doomed to fail. And I think Mojang should know this all too well, considering the influx of feedback. If only Microsoft were willing to listen. (EDIT: I don't even think this on Microsoft at this point. I really do think you guys at Mojang just aren't willing to listen to the feedback.)

If this """""feature""""" makes it into the final 1.19.1 release, then 1.19.0 will be the last version I'll be sticking with for the foreseeable future - if I choose to continue playing the game at all. The new content that will be in future releases is absolutely NOT worth the downgrade that this unwanted addition entails.

I will refuse to play on any server that doesn't disable this with a plugin/mod

And if you make it impossible to disable I will report hundreds of comments as a hobby, all of them valid gray-area comments that could be perceived as pushing it so as to not abuse the system, just to make moderation as expensive as possible.

Naturally anyone who actually clearly breaks the rules I will refuse to report to Mojang, on principle.

I run a server with a few hundred active players and it isn't cheap, maybe I'll make this my cue to quit Minecraft after over a decade, I wonder how many would not bother playing anymore if my server was gone.
please don't add chat reporting, you're going to scare everyone away from multiplayer!

I’d like to make it clear I play bedrock but I feel this might effect YouTubers, Twitch streamers, and other people who play Minecraft for a living. So for 1.19.1 in Java I’m concerned about incorrect bans and abusive chat reporting. Also the option to turn off moderation for private servers would be really helpful for friends who like to mess around and write stupid things on signs. Thank You.

 

-Concerned Player,

HiHelloIts

Please! Don't force this upon us, private servers have moderated themselves from the start, you'll be inflicting irreversible damage to Minecraft multiplayer, actively discouraging people from exploring new servers.

What about people taunting other players into swearing? What about complex context that exists on specific servers? What about problems that come to exist if you take in mind that the community speaks more languages than just English?

This will cause more problems than it will solve.

Pro tip (I am not an expert): Let server (or realm) owners CUSTOMISE their moderation, AND you should NOT ban players from all Multiplayer servers and Realms in general.

Please or Minecraft might DIE.

Get rid of chat reporting 

and fix cave biomes they are so boring based on this planetminecraft datapack better cave gen that I made sorry no link

Everybody hates the new reporting "feature".

Please stop trying to convince us we want it

Having a report feature is a good thing, but the current implementation in Minecraft Java Edition restricts the control that server hosts have over their own servers for the sake of security and pushes a lot of responsibility off of server hosts and onto Mojang and Microsoft, this could be a liability problem, there needs to be a robust and easy to access appeal process that allows players to give context to the reported message and the server they were on, and rather than preventing banned players from accessing multiplayer, add the player to an official ban list, allow private server hosts to enable or disable the official ban list via the server config file, this would enable or disable player reporting for their server as well, add an icon next to the server list showing which servers have the ban list enabled or disabled, a parental option could be added to prevent a child from joining a server with the official ban list disabled, which would be enabled by default on underage accounts, this would put responsibility back in the hands of server hosts, players, and the parents of children, while also protecting the younger Minecraft community members from inappropriate content in multiplayer.

I am an administrator for a SMP server that has been around for almost 6 years, and have been playing Minecraft for more than 8 years as of writing this. I see why Mojang is implementing this, but banning players from ALL ONLINE SERVERS for just one bad comment is wrong. First of all, third party servers are not owned by Microsoft, and therefore should not be subject to their bans. Second, people create servers that are for adults only, so they have different policies than Microsoft's. Third, banning people from playing online and in single player (even though they paid for the account) quite possibly violates many consumer rights laws, leaving this update to the possibility of legal action. Finally, servers have been handling chat moderation since they were first created, with little to no problems occurring. Along with different server policies and punishments, if several people decided to report me (resulting in my ban from online play),I would no longer be able to operate and play on the server THAT I OWN. Overall, throughout my many years of playing, I have loved many of Minecraft's updates, but this one upsets me and many others.

Thank you for your time and attention,

                                                     -LegoMasterV

"outdated server" error screeen - my windows 10 PC won't install the latest update. Instead it still has 1.19.2. My friend has the latest update and the he can't access my world - it says "outdated server." How do I get the latest update on my PC? My operating system is up-to-date.

Although the intentions might be good, the execution of this player report feature will not work for Minecraft Multiplayer. Why are you trying to enforce this more than a decade later when it initially launched?

The past decade alot of (third party) servers have arisen, which all have their own way of moderating the game. Those (sub-)communities all have a variety of age, meaning no server fits all.
Now here's the biggest issue: this system only focusses on just one group, being smaller children, while leaving out the rest. 

A better way to do this, is allowing an optional parenting feature that only allows smaller children to join Mojang affiliated services, such as realms. That way they won't be exposed to third party servers. This way the power stays for third party services in the community who to welcome on their server or not (using their own ban system as they already do), and allows Mojang to protect who desire it.

Remember: no-one is forced to stay on a server and can leave whenever they want. 
Interference from Mojangs side would only undermine the control players have over their servers, which should be avoided at all cost. Not only would this gives trust issues, it also would split the community even further. 

So in short: as someone who has played this game for over a decade: please listen to the community, do not continue with this (flawed) system. Leave the moderation to the community and don't take that right away from us.

Thanks alot!
This is a god-awful idea, and will only push your fanbase away from your game.
Just drop chat reporting mods can fake messages so people can just trick the mods into banning people with no way to tell it’s faked

The community has been talking about removing the report system for about 2 months.

You're not listening.
ratio
REMOVE IT. literally NO ONE WANTS THIS.
just removing chat reporting. Or just stop making these posts because you aren't even taking the feedback

Microsoft/Mojang, I understand about trying to keep players safe and add a chat report system but the way you implemented it is disgraceful! Player report system can be abused easily, for example: A person really hates you for some reason and literally reports you for a ridiculous reason, for example you said "I'm going to jump off a cliff" that is not meant to be offensive, the "highly trained moderators" will deliberately ban you for that. So please, either remove chat report system or add a setting that can disable/enable this feature. Because of 1.19.1 chat reporting update, it's most likely that players are terrified about if they're going to be banned after saying a single chat. Also, server owners/admins can take care with moderation themselves, which was great until the update came. In fact, it's even worse than Roblox moderation. Microsoft/Mojang, your community doesn't want this and nobody does. This is  absurd!

Implementing this is a worst idea ever. Don't do this. The community doesn't want it and they are talking about removing this for 2 or 3 months now.

You're ignoring what the community wants, Microsoft. You're ruining everything!
Un nerf the sculk xp changes and get rid of chat reportinG
ratio

This community will be crushed under this update. It’s heartbreaking that the fun block game that I have been playing for years has devolved like this.

This chat reporting and banning thing will be the downfall of Minecraft.

It makes me feel like there’s no point in even trying to argue, because the more negative feedback that Mojang and Microsoft get, the more it feels like they are trying to make this thing work when it is just a bad idea all around. Like trying to fit an elephant in a square shaped hole.

This whole thing makes me feel unsafe to play the game I love, when I’m probably just going to be permanently banned anyway for no fault of my own.

What’s even the point of playing Minecraft with this feature when I could literally be doing anything else?

This whole thing makes me feel so angry, but I know that insulting whoever had the idea to implement chat moderation and permanent banning and online banning— and even this whole system, is not going to help anyone.

This whole thing makes me feel like lashing out, but no amount of insulting Mojang’s mother is going to get anyone anywhere. So I beg of you, please. Listen. To. Your. Reviews. It’s really not that hard. There are thousands of people who are against this 1.19.1 banning update, and many who have suggested things to help improve it. Such as getting rid of the whole system.

Frankly, I really don’t care all that much, as much as leaving a few angry reviews is ‘much’. Just know that if this goes through and becomes a problem, then the legacy of Minecraft will not be much of a good legacy at all.
Listen to your community. We do NOT want this! Don't let Microsoft force you to do this.

Remove the entire Chat Reporting Feature, Look at what happened to bedrock and also MOST java servers are privately run using 3rd party servers and thus SHOULD not be FORCED to do this, LISTEN TO THE COMMUNITY.
i wonder if they have removed herobrine, idk about you all but ive been fearing for my life about him since 2011

I'm gonna keep it real simple. Hopefully you will actually approve the comment this time.

I don't like the chat report feature. Please, actually listen to the community. It's very clear a majority do not want this feature either. There are a lot of comments I've seen that have some actual good feedback. The system is flawed, and will be abused. It either needs a total rework, or shelved permanently.

~just a random player from beta 1.8
How braindead are yall? Theres been nothing but negative feedback and your STILL going ahead with this??

- Allow Servers to opt-out of the universal bans from the chat reporting system & show a warning prompt when players attempt to connect to said servers

-An account that's been Universally Banned should still have access to LAN play via Multiplayer, a status message should be shown on the multiplayer screen stating the account's been banned from online play.

Universal Bans should only take affect on servers that have opted into the global chat moderation. Server owners should have the option to participate in this system and not be forced to.

Even if servers opt-out of the message signature system, thus disabling the chat reporting on the server, Minecraft accounts that are banned would still be unable to play on servers that had opted-out of the message signature system.

Universal Bans should not disable the multiplayer screen because this also blocks access to LAN play.

I'm not even going to ask for the chat reporting feature to be rolled back/removed as it's been made clear by your official Mojang community moderators who have posted on the Minecraft subreddit that this system will not be removed.
People will begin to care less about whatever else comes in this update, and further updates, until Mojang delivers a response to their lack of attention to the community regarding player reports

As someone who's been playing minecraft for a long time, both on other friends devices and my own, I'm seriously dissapointed but the path Minecraft is going down in terms of moderation. If this is something Microsoft is going to persue nomatter community outlash, I pray that servers can opt into Microsoft regulated banning. But like most, I'd rather the report system not be implemented whatsoever. Online servers and realms have been moderated by it's users for years sucessfully without help. This new implementation is not only unecessary, but unwanted.
From inparticular ban reasons to the unclearity about unban requests, this implementation has done more harm to the community than good. I, like many others, hope to see this idea discarded.
Player chat reporting should be only on Realms. Other server are not owned by Mojang/microsoft

Mojang, the reporting system is bad, after adding it, people will fall into false bans, which will lead to a drop in online and the death of the game. As a small server owner, I don't want my small server to get smaller. I became afraid to respond to greetings from strangers on large servers. People will start downloading more pirated versions and less official ones. Minecraft may die and Hytale will become a famous game. Make it so that people can safely play Minecraft, do not ruin this wonderful sandbox

If the player report system is added I will no longer play on severs out of fear of being reported unless there is a viable workaround. As an adult I don’t feel I need to be protected from obscenities. I believe a proper solution to this problem would be to simply explain to parents the dangers of letting their child play online.

Remove chat report system! This will kill minecraft!

 

#saveminecraft
ITS FRICKIN MID

For years Minecraft has been a game, where everyone was able to decide what happens on their own server. That was one of its best things - you decide what's going on. With this update, you are taking people's rights to control their own server, which is the main problem for me. If you want your server to be family-friendly, you can very easily do that.

The other major problem - is false reports. No matter how many people review a report, it is still possible that people get falsely banned. I don't wish that to me, or to anyone else. I just want to enjoy Minecraft the way I have done all these years, without worrying that if I say something that someone doesn't like, I won't be able to play anymore.
Microsoft minecraft is not going to be family friendly don't try anyting

This "feature" need at least to be reworked.

 

It needs at least:

- An Option for server admins to disable this
- Or a workflow, that Server admins can choose what messages would be send to mojang and which not
Nobody wanted a chat report system, I hope it can be removed.

Honestly the best thing to do at this point is make the Player Report feature an opt in or opt out option for server owners and to be mandatory for only realms since realms is more of an official server.

Also giving the option for ban appeals and something less severe than a permanent ban, after all, other games use this method and i cannot see why it can't be this way here.

This is why people are mad, because there are no other options beyond a permanent ban without any way of making a ban appeal so if a ban happens by mistake or due to malicious players then that ban will stay forever and the account will be lost without a chance of playing multiplayer ever again.

Just these small changes to make it less severe and it would be a good addition for those that, for example, don't want to or can't moderate a custom server.

The more options the better in my opinion.

Heya. Don't know if you're aware of it, but nobody that plays Multiplayer likes the new Chat Report feature as much as you'd like them to. Too easy for trolls and vengeful people to ban innocent players from ever playing Multiplayer again. There's a movement going on that claims this feature will be your downfall if allowed to stay. Either tweak it to be trollproof or remove it is all I can say.

I agree with you.  All the work and effort put into getting to all the biomes to find the enchanged books and not to get to the highest levels was disappointing.  Then when i did all the extra work to get multiple books to combine to find out that it became "too expensive" to make end game armor was really disappointing.  

At first I was okay this will take some effort to get all the books to combine to the levels I am wanting, and then totally deflated when i could not add these levels to my armor to get my end game armor.  Was really disappointing. 

Upgrading the ability to be able to utilize these books would be ideal.  Since we go thru the effort to gather the items needed to trade, the XP needed to combine to level up and apply, and continuing to replace the anvil....where is the reward for all the effort working in all the biomes we are traveling to and fro?
